body.name: Ring Solar Charger for Video Doorbell (2nd Generation - 2020 Release)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 17. Order within 1 hr 17 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 17. Order within 13 hrs 47 mins
features: Extend the battery life of your Video Doorbell (2nd Generation - 2020 release) with the help of a solar power source.
Keeps your doorbell charged up to 35% longer than previous solar charger generations.
Includes a secure mounting bracket for easy installation with weather-resistant built-in solar panels.
Install in a location where it can receive at least 3-4 hours of direct sunlight per day for best performance.

This product only works with Ring Video Doorbell (2nd Generation - 2020 release) with a micro-USB connector. It is not compatible with Ring Video Doorbell 2 or any other Ring doorbells with a fork-style power connector.

productInformation.name: Dimensions
productInformation.value: 5.8 in x 3.6 in x 0.5 in (14.8 cm x 9.3 cm x 1.3 cm)

productInformation.name: Setup Requirement
productInformation.value: Requires compatible Ring Battery Video Doorbell. Install Solar Charger in a location without obstruction from the sun, where it can receive at least 3-4 hours of direct sunlight per day. For best results, install facing South if located in the northern hemisphere; install facing North if located in the southern hemisphere. Fully charge the doorbell battery before installing the doorbell in the Solar Charger.

productInformation.name: Supported Devices
productInformation.value: Video Doorbell, (2nd Generation) Works with Wedge Kit or Corner Kit for Video Doorbell (2nd Generation). *Ring recommends the use of only one Wedge or Corner Kit with Solar charger.

productInformation.name: Box Includes
productInformation.value: Solar Charger (micro-USB connector), Mounting Screws & Anchors, User Guide

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keeps Ring camera charged up for months if it gets plenty of sunlight
reviews.reviewText: I have had the original version of this for a little over 2 years, and have now purchased the newer version, which has the same product title, and looks like it is the same product.The newer one has a new AMZN page, but I think they are the same product:Original AMZN page (currently unavailable): https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B085DVTYHNNew AMZN page: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0B3F9LS2GHere are my experiences with the product over the past 2+ years.I have just replaced it with the newer one and don't have enough experience yet to say if it is identical or not.My installation placement was so that it received full sun for several hours. It works pretty good, and kept the Ring doorbell charged for many months in all seasons. I did have problems and had to manually remove and recharge the Ring camera when we had a week or more of clouds and rain--in that case, the Ring battery went to zero after about a week or so.I have replaced the product now because the original one will no longer charge the camera due to the 3 solar panels being totally degraded. Orginal panels are slick and shiny, but 2+ years old panels look like black sandpaper. They no longer produce any power.Overall, for the price it's a good product, even if it has to be replaced every couple of years. That works out to about $25 a year, plus the bother of re-installing the new one, which just went right back where the old one already was -- same mounting holes, screws, size, etc. I put the same old Ring camera back on the new solar charger.If this little solar charger won't work for you, then you probably need a remote solar panel. Look for the ones sold (or similar with the right connector you need) for the Ring Stickup cams. Those are large panels, and can be placed at a distance and are easier to face towards the sun. I have several of those with Stickup Cams, and I've never had to manually recharge those batteries that are connected to the large panels, even during those long cloudy rainy periods.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far sooo good
reviews.reviewText: I installed this about a week ago when my Ring Plus doorbell battery was at 50%. It’s been semi sunny quite a few days since and the doorbell is west facing.Today the battery is at 74%. It’s not a crazy fast charge but nor is that needed. Hopefully it lasts and gives me years without needing to plug in the battery.Installation took about 10 minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Workability depends on where your ring is located!
reviews.reviewText: We purchased this hoping it would charge our front door ring. Regrettably it did not work for our front door as our awning provided too much shade. The solar charger did however work on our back door. The sun directly hit the solar lenses and has worked wonderfully for the past 7 months.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very satisfied with solar charger (bought Nov 2023)
reviews.reviewText: I am very satisfied with this charger, I get very little sun where my ring is, probably 2-3 morning hours at best during autumn/winter. So far I haven't had to charge my wireless ring a single time ever since I installed this solar charger. I have another ring in my office and have had to charge it once in the same timeframe. On very low sun / cloudy days my charge goes down to 60ish %, and when we have a sunnier morning, it goes up 1-3% daily. It's stayed consistently in the 60-75% charge which is great. I will update my review if anything changes for better or worst during the summer period when it's far too hot outside and probably get a bit more (and stronger) sun time.Installation was a breeze, if you already have a ring wireless installed, the solar panel fits directly over the drilled areas of the ring. If you are buying both together and installing for the first time it's pretty easy to just drill your 4 holes and screw everything on top.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I Can’t Tell if this Works
reviews.reviewText: I followed the directions by fully charging my doorbell battery prior to installing. It says “Soar Status Not Connected “ at all times, prior to installing and after installing. Installation wasn’t hard but the instructions were terrible as the photos do not show you how to connect the wire to the solar panel. It’s winter so I’m not getting tons of sunlight right now, but I. Can’t tell if I wasted 45 bucks on this or not. The return window could close before I ever see improvement - what’s the point of of an uncharged security camera? If it does not work during its time on the porch, you will not feel safe. I’m sort of regretting this expensive purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Ring helped me
reviews.reviewText: I had a previous review of my dissatisfaction of the ring solar charger because I was still having to change out batteries frequently. A CS Rep got in touch with so they could work with me and see how they can help me resolve the issue. After going back and forth, I am happy to say that the issue is resolved. Unbelievable customer service and very patient. Thank you Mathew & Melissa for reaching out and helping me. Appreciate it very much.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solar charger actually works
reviews.reviewText: It works great. If you feel as if you're recharging your Ring doorbell way too often, the solar charger is a true blessing. I've had it installed for over a month, and the charge level has never been below 78%

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Less impressive than it should be
reviews.reviewText: The output from the solar panel is very small. You can tell just by looking at it that the surface area of the cells is just, well, unimpressive. However, despite this, I have not had to charge my ring doorbell 3 plus a single time since I installed it months ago.The panel gets tons of direct sunlight for about 6 hours per day. My battery usage works out to be about 2% a day, and the panel charges about 2% a day. For the summer months, my battery percentage stayed the same. I have noticed a drop-off since the peak of summer, and my usage is now slightly more than the panel produces.The concept of using solar is great, the execution is weak, but acceptable. It works.
It keeps my Ring doorbell charged to at least 75% at all times, even when cloudy. Installation was a breeze.
Works very well after an easy install. I had to extend my wifi range to reach the install point, even so this works with no hassels.

Un peu réticent au début mais c'est normal, il commence seulement a charger a partir de 80% , la batterie se charge très lentement mais sa suffit a la maintenir, j'arrive a 68% defois 58% après ça remonte alors que vraiment le soleil se fait rare, bien 👍
Montage einfach, wird vom Gerät erkannt, lädt bei geringen Sonnenstunden ca 2% mal sehen, wie es über den Winter ausreicht. Sonst mal manuell aufladen.
